title: The Inverse Function Theorem
text: The Inverse Function Theorem is $$g'(x)=\frac{1}{h{\left(g{\left(x\right)}\right)}}$$ where g(x) is the inverse of f(x) and $$h(x)=f'(x)$$ or in other words h(x) is the derivative of f(x).

title: Finding the Inverse of f(x) at $$a=0$$.
text: To find the inverse of f(x) where $$a=2$$, then we need to first find what value of $$x$$ when we plug it into f(x) will give us a value of $$2$$. In this case, it is when $$x=6$$, so we know that $$g(2)=6$$ where g(x) is the inverse of f(x).

title: Finding the Derivative of f(g(x)), where g(x) is the inverse of f(x).
text: We found that the inverse of f(x) $$=6$$ in the previous hint, therefore we need next know what f'(6) equals, which is given to us, it is $$\frac{1}{3}$$.

title: Applying the Inverse Function Theorem
text: Since we know that h(g(6)) where g(x) is the inverse of f(x) and h(x) is the derivative of f(x) equals $$\frac{1}{3}$$, we can can apply the inverse function theorem by doing 1/(our answer). In this case this is $$\frac{1}{\frac{1}{3}}=3$$.
